p: Winged bean was used since a long time as a medicinal plant in different countries: its fruits and roots were used as medicines that increase strength, and as treatment of ulcers in New Guinea [ 49]. Moreover, its leaves were used as treatment of small pox and its tubers were used in the treatment of vertigo in Malaya, both for external use. Nowadays, different studies were done to investigate the anti-oxidant, antimicrobial, anti-inflammatory and antiproliferative activities of different extracts from this plant [ 50, 51].
